comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This pic appeared in the Australian Town & Country Journal in March 1891 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article63616320 ...Courtesy of Beachcomber's ship spotting (!) it's probably reasonable to conclude that this pic was taken during the period RMS Orient was in Sydney ie. 2-14 March, 1891 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13816088 ...the clock and accompanying bells for the GPO tower didn't arrive in Sydney until July 1891...hence the still vacant space we see here. Hey, if you're into clouds this pic is amazing (for 1891!). Looks like a bit of rain to the south...or maybe smoke from chimneys...or a rubbish tip?
